column4: could anyone, please, help me with my printer problem: We have a printserver in the net with 2 printers (lp3,lp2) and because we want our windows machines to use them, I shall configure the cups on our samba machine to pass the raw data overto the printserver
problem is: I do not find that f'in option. Where can I find official docs for gnome-printer-manager?
for passing through "raw" data to the printserver
and I can not managa that printer over webinterface as admin-tasks are disabled
I select the printer and then I can select drivers (ps, hpjs ...)
~hia
can you tell me how to configure which user get the mail for root?
in /etc/aliases you can specify that
thanks
do you know how it is possible to forward rootmail to a remote system?
ok, now that was to obvious ;)
can you help me?
is the repository for freenx reachable again?
yes
do you have any plans to move your repository of freenx to a server with better availability?
yes
or simply passwd -l $evilguy
I think you had a pasting area at your host, right?
the -d argument needs a parameter...
hm? Do you know for sure or are you guessing?
if -d is meant as argument to your program, then you need to prepend it with -- so start-stop-daemon won't interpret it
aaah, so we're getting closer
now I get an error from the start stop daemon which tells me that argument --d is not known
so actually the daemon figured it as an option for itself not for the program that should have been run
